Solar thermal heating: Install solar thermal panels on your roof to harness the sun's energy and heat your home. This can be used for both hot water and space heating.
Biomass heating: Use organic materials such as wood chips, pellets, or agricultural waste to create a bioenergy system that heats your home. This can be an eco-friendly alternative to fossil fuels.
Hydrogen fuel cells: Invest in hydrogen fuel cells to generate electricity and heat your home. This can be a clean and efficient way to produce heat without relying on fossil fuels.
Wind power: Install a wind turbine to generate electricity, which can then be used to heat your home through an electric heating system.
Passive solar design: Optimize your home's design to take advantage of natural sunlight and minimize heat loss. This can include features such as south-facing windows, thermal mass, and insulation.
